Package ohos.bluetooth

Class SppClientSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.bluetooth.SppClientSocket

  • public class SppClientSocket
extends Object
    Provides Serial Port Profile (SPP) client sockets.

    To use this class, you must use DataListenSocket to create an SppServerSocket. When a new connection is accepted by the server, SppServerSocket#accept returns a new SppClientSocket to manage the data link.

    On the client, you can use SppClientSocket to start a new socket connection.

    Since:
    7

        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect​()
             throws IOException
        Connects to a remote device over the socket.

        When this method is called, the link will be blocked until the connection is established or fails.

        It is not recommended that you initiate an SPP connection during device discovery, which occupies many chip resources and slows down the connection. You can use BluetoothHost#cancelBtDiscovery() to cancel the device discovery operation.

        close() can be used to disable the connection.

        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if an error occurs, for example, a connection failure.
        Since:
        7

      • close

        public void close​()
           throws IOException
        Disables a connection and releases related resources.

        If the connection has been disabled, calling this method triggers no operation.

        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the SppClientSocket fails to be disabled.
        Since:
        7

      • getSppClientConnectionType

        public int getSppClientConnectionType​()
        Obtains the connection type of a socket.
        Returns:
        Returns RFCOMM_SOCKET.
        Since:
        7

      • getSppClientInputStream

        public InputStream getSppClientInputStream​()
        Obtains the input stream of a socket.

        The input stream will be returned even if the socket is disconnected.

        Returns:
        Returns the input stream for writing data.
        Since:
        7

      • getSppClientOutputStream

        public OutputStream getSppClientOutputStream​()
        Obtains the output stream of a socket.

        The output stream will be returned even if the socket is disconnected.

        Returns:
        Returns the output stream for reading data.
        Since:
        7

      • isSppClientConnected

        public boolean isSppClientConnected​()
        Obtains the connection status of a socket.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the socket is connected; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        7
